This is actually such a wonderful idea. I have a little brother around the age of fifteen and he isn't new at all to PC games and in fact runs his own minecraft servers is an active member in the minecraft and steam community and has a gaming PC that very well rivals anything i've seen even at my age. What blows is when I introduced him to the game that his brother loves to play and would love to play with him as a form of 21st century bonding. He downloaded it, installed, waited hours for all the patches to finish, we loaded up, and the tutorial pretty much wrecked him. He's not one to give up so we continued, trying to figure it out but even once he got passed the basic controls, all the minor objective's goals and strategies we all know by instinct totally screwed him over because of the lack of context. I always say the best way to learn the game is to play it, but if you are playing it wrong and wrong time and time again that isn't helping anyone and only further reinforces the terrible playing habits. I'm hoping this could help my brother out and maybe we can get to playing together soon. Thank you Riot. :)

That comment was Shrekcellent!
They should let like a veteran player sign up for like training the people that just started the game and teach them tips and tricks.

"I can finally teach these useless f*kers how to play!

"God you suck. I understood all this in five minutes! How the hell do you not get this? Go back to Call of Duty, worthless scrub."

I expect a significant number of "veteran" LoL players to be very much like this.

sorry to say, but im not one of those "significant number of vetrans" and i dont think that telling people they suck is going to help them improve. if we want NON-toxic players in the future, then we need to show them some respect for their scrub-lordiness and help them improve to continue teaching new generations to not rage at people who absolutely suck. My mom always said, if u cant say anything nice while dieing, then dont say anything while dieing at all.

I can see it now. The new phrase to tell bad players in your games. "god you suck, go back and play intro bots." If only people weren't as toxic, we'd have an easier time learning the game. A more enjoyable time.
Riot we don't talk about how bad I was when I first started.
Im pretty sure alot of us still {{summoner:11}} champs..
